About.Name: Ian K. Wilson
About.AboutText: Hi, I am Ian. I am a passionate Information Systems major with a keen interest in coding, data analysis, and system optimization. Currently, I am pursuing my undergraduate degree at Seattle Pacific University. I am dedicated to expanding my knowledge and skills in various areas of technology, with a particular focus on programming and practical application development. I enjoy tackling challenging coding projects and thrive in environments where I can contribute my expertise and learn from my peers. During my studies, I have worked on several impactful projects, including my Eagle Scout project, which solidified my commitment to a career that combines my love for technology and problem-solving. Beyond the classroom, I actively engage in activities related to technology and the outdoors, finding inspiration in camping and skiing. These experiences have taught me the importance of adaptability, perseverance, and teamworkâ€”values I carry into my professional life. Looking ahead, I am eager to leverage my skills and experience to contribute to innovative projects in Information Systems. I aspire to collaborate with like-minded individuals and organizations that value creativity, continuous learning, and positive impact. Let's connect and explore the possibilities together!

Experience.EducationText: Information System's Major with a Minor in History. President of the Centurions Club.
Experience.SkillsText: Relevant knowledge to coding in C++ and web designing using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML.

Project1.Title: Task-Manager-Project
Project1.Desc: A full-stack Task Manager web app built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, Express, and Mongoose, featuring real-time updates using Socket.io. It supports task CRUD operations and stores data in MongoDB Atlas, with a focus on intuitive UI and a efficient functionality.

Project2.Title: Node-Project
Project2.Desc: A Node.js and Express-powered web application for task/list management. Features a responsive client interface for adding, editing, and deleting tasks, with a focus on non-blocking, error-managed server interactions.

Project3.Title: HTTP-Project
Project3.Desc: A versatile JavaScript front-end library for handling HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH). Features async operations, error handling, and a user-friendly UI for testing API responses. Utilizes Fetch API for efficient, non-blocking requests and response handling.
